required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metronidazole Drug Interaction Study With MMX® Mesalazine/Mesalamine
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Open-label, Crossover, Drug Interaction Study Evaluating the Pharmacokinetic Profiles of Metronidazole Administered Alone and in Combination With MMX® Mesalazine/Mesalamine in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Drug interaction study evaluating the pharmacokinetic profiles of Metronidazole administered alone & in combination with MMX® Mesalazine/mesalamine

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve (AUC) at Steady State for Metronidazole
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed over a 24-hour period starting post-dose on day 4
primary_outcome.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) at Steady State for Metronidazole
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed over a 24-hour period starting post-dose on day 4
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.

intervention.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine placebo once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine placebo single dose on Day 4 orally
Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g single dose on Day 4 orally

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Age 18-55 years inclusive at the time of consent. The date of signing informed consent is defined as the beginning of the Screening Period.
2. Subject is willing to comply with any applicable contraceptive requirements of the protocol and is:
- Male, or
- Non-pregnant, non-lactating female
- Females must be at least 90 days post-partum or nulliparous.
Exclusion Criteria
1. A history of current or recurrent disease that could affect the colon. This includes gastrointestinal disease, peptic ulceration, gastrointestinal bleeding, celiac disease, lactose intolerance, ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease, or Irritable Bowel Syndrome. Subjects who have a history of chronic constipation, which is physician diagnosed and treated, will also be excluded from the study (frequency of bowel movements >48 hours between samples).
2. A history of current or relevant serious, severe, or unstable (acute or progressive) physical or psychiatric illness.
3. A history of gastrointestinal surgery performed within the past 12 months prior to the first dose of investigational product, with the exception of an appendectomy.
4. A history of or current clinically relevant moderate or severe renal or hepatic impairment.
5. A history of asthma or bronchospasm associated with the use of 5-ASA or other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
6. Known or suspected intolerance or hypersensitivity to the investigational product or metronidazole, closely related compounds, or any of the stated ingredients
7. A history of, or current, pancreatitis.

group.title: Metronidazole + MMX Placebo First
group.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX placebo once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX placebo single dose on Day 4 orally,first; then Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g single dose on Day 4 orally, second

group.title: Metronidazole + MMX Mesalazine/Mesalamine First
group.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g single dose on Day 4 orally, first; then Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX placebo once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX placebo single dose on Day 4 orally, second

group.title: Metronidazole + MMX Placebo First
group.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX placebo once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX placebo single dose on Day 4 orally,first; then Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g single dose on Day 4 orally, second

group.title: Metronidazole + MMX Mesalazine/Mesalamine First
group.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g single dose on Day 4 orally, first; then Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX placebo once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX placebo single dose on Day 4 orally, second

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve (AUC) at Steady State for Metronidazole
outcome.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed over a 24-hour period starting post-dose on day 4
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set defined as all subjects in the Safety Analysis Set for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable. The Safety Analysis Set consists of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 postdose safety assessment.

group.title: Metronidazole + MMX Placebo
group.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX placebo once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX placebo single dose on Day 4 orally

group.title: Metronidazole + MMX Mesalazine/Mesalamine
group.description: Metronidazole 750 mg twice daily + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g once daily for 3 days orally, then Metronidazole 750 mg single dose + MMX Mesalazine/mesalamine 4.8 g single dose on Day 4 orally

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve (AUC) at Steady State for Metronidazole
measure.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set defined as all subjects in the Safety Analysis Set for whom the primary pharmacokinetic data were considered sufficient and interpretable. The Safety Analysis Set consists of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 postdose safety assessment.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: If the 90% Confidence Intervals of the geometric mean ratio are wholly contained within the interval (0.80, 1.25), then the hypothesis of a drug interaction will be rejected.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) at Steady State for Metronidazole
outcome.description: Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed over a 24-hour period starting post-dose on day 4

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
